This is a list of '''earthquakes in Canada''':

| 2011-09-09
| 19:31:34
| [[Vancouver Island]]
| 49.49
| -126.97
|
| 6.4
| M<sub>w</sub>
|
| This earthquake, which lasted 20–30 seconds, was the strongest to hit the region in nearly 7 years. It occurred on a [[Earthquake#Earthquake fault types|secondary strike-slip]] structure and not on the plate boundary itself
| <ref>{{cite news|last=Mann|first=Ted|title=Vancouver Looks to New Zealand to Prepare for Quakes|url=http://www.theatlanticwire.com/global/2011/09/vancouver-looks-new-zealand-prepare-quakes/42324/|accessdate=18 September 2011|newspaper=The Atlantic Wire|date=10 September 2011}}</ref>

Abbreviations used:
<small>
* M<sub>w</sub> [[Moment magnitude scale]]
* M<sub>L</sub> [[Richter magnitude scale]]
* M<sub>s</sub> [[Surface wave magnitude]] scale
* M<sub>n</sub> Nuttli magnitude scale—a version of the Richter scale specifically for use in eastern North America<ref name="NRC_FAQ">{{cite web|url=http://earthquakescanada.nrcan.gc.ca/info-gen/faq-eng.php#ml_and_mn|title=Frequently Asked Questions about Earthquakes (FAQ)|last=Natural Resources Canada|date=12 August 2011|accessdate=3 December 2011}}</ref></small>
